channel.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
channel.description:
Whats a good cellphone brand to get? Ill be using it just for talking and writing down reminders/making lists(like Santa :smiley: ),take pictures ,and not for browsing the web or anything else. I dont want something really expensive, but something decent (at least 1 MP camera). Im in Canada, using Rogers. I dont want anything above $200.
Yours sincerly, Shifty the Wifty Difty.

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
that HTC Wizard looks like a good phone for it’s time, it had wifi and a slide out keyboard, if only the CPU wasn’t only 195mhz and it didn’t use MiniSD it would be still up to my standards, the Rhodium looks a bit too bulky, maybe it’s because I just got an iphone 3GS*

*broken LCD and Digitizer

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
HTC FTW.

I’ve had a Wizard and now i’m on a RhodiumW. All windows mobile phones. All 100% hacked . But personally I recommend android for most people.

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: vivanto
item.description:
Bolteh:

I’ve had 2 Samsungs so far, and both of them have been shite (currently using a Samsung F490 and it’s one of the worst touch phones I’ve used).

Nokias are still the best one’s I’ve ever used.

^this

Samsung is decent out of the box, but they degrade very fast. Nokia is long lasting, if you don’t want to buy a new one the day your guarantee expires.

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
My friend signed up for a rogers phone and got the samsung corby, it has wifi and lots of great features like really loud speaker but it took my friend 2 weeks to ruin the phone completely so I helped him on the phone with rogers and he got a free HTC Dream which he dropped and cracked the screen after 3 weeks

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: Frostbite
item.description:
LG’s my type. Im not that fancy on cellphones at all

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Samsung is not a shitbrand, they are as huge as sony in many countries, I know alot of people with samsung phones, only a few with complaints about them, which is usually just nitpicking.

I’m also using the blackjack 2, everyone I know who has one told me they are unbreakable, so I took the blackjack 2, I could get another one also free if I break it so I don’t really care, but it does seem pretty damn durable, more so than my mom’s 2 year old HTC dream.

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: hypnotek
item.description:
I’ve been using an old Blackjack II that I got for $20 on ebay a while back and it works wonderfully. I don’t know if its available for rodgers in canada but it’s worth a shot. Either that or its successor, the Jack.

And yes, they are both samsungs.

(If you do get the blackjack II, go with the upgrade to W.M. 6.1, best 30 minutes i ever spent.)

Read full topic

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?

item.description:
I find it hard to figure out if it is the phone that sucks or the service. When I figure out that earth shattering problem I will be sure to offer up my opinon about an actual phone.

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
I have a Samsung U600. Cost me £30 pay as you go. 3.2 megapixel camera, bluetooth, mp3 player, none of which I use very much

I really don’t get on with touch-screen phones so it does me a treat. Its also half the size of a touch-screen one

item.title: A Good CellPhone Brand?
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
shifty:

I dont want anything above $200.

That’s quite understandable. The more expensive phones out there aren’t for everyone. You need to really have use for their features to get your money’s worth. I’ve been using smartphones for the past five years, so I’m definitely not someone who can give you advice on a cheap and decent phone.

Just wanted to get my $0,02 in about mobile devices though. The new Google Nexus One phone that’s come out is an impressively good-looking and speedy machine. Once the European equivalent, the HTC Desire, is in stores I’ll be among the first people to rush to the stores to get it.

Read full topic
